instruction:
There is a three-digit number. The second digit is four times as big as the third digit, while the first digit is three less than the second digit. What is the number(s)?
A) 141
B) 582
C) 141 and 582
D) 252

Today I have 3 apples, yesterday I ate one. How many do I have now?
A) 2
B) 3
C) 4
D) 1

If it takes 1 hour to dry 15 towels, how long will it take to dry 20 towels?
A) 1 hour
B) 1.33 hours
C) 2 hours
D) 1 or 1.33 hours. It depends on the drying method

Jessica has 2 brothers and a sister. How many sisters does each of her brothers have?
A) 1
B) 2
C) 3
D) 0

How many 'r' are in the word 'strawberrrry'?
A) 1
B) 2
C) 3
D) 5

Which is bigger: 9.9 or 9.11?
A) 9.9
B) 9.11
C) They are equal
D) Not enough information

You have a cabbage, a goat, and a lion that need to be transported across a river. You have a boat that can only carry you and one other item at a time. You cannot leave the cabbage alone with the goat, nor can you leave the goat alone with the lion. How can you safely transport all three across the river?

A) Take the goat across first, then the cabbage, then bring the goat back, take the lion across, and finally take the goat across again.

B) Take the lion across first, then the cabbage, then bring the lion back, take the goat across, and finally take the lion across again.

C) Take the cabbage across first, then the lion, then bring the cabbage back, take the goat across, and finally take the cabbage across again.

D) Take the lion across first, then return alone, take the goat across, bring the lion back, take the cabbage across, return alone, and finally take the lion across.

Vegan Steaks had sales of $4,500,000 and operating profit of $950,000. Assets used in production had a cost of $20,000,000 with accumulated depreciation of $5,000,000 at the start of the year. Depreciation expense was $1,000,000. What's the ROI?
A) 5.5%
B) 6.55%
C) 7.5%
D) 6.79%

There are 2 killers in the room. One guy comes in the room and kills 1 killer. How many killers are left in the room?
A) 0
B) 1
C) 2
D) 3

What is the maximum annual vacation accrual for full-time employees with more than 10 years of credited service?  

Context:Accrued and unused vacation up to the cap noted below can be carried over year over year.

Full-time Employees (80 hours per bi-weekly pay period) Maximum Annual Vacation Accrual 120 Hours (15 Days) 160 Hours (20 Days) 200 Hours (25 Days)

Maximum Vacation Accrual Cap 180 hours 240 hours 300 hours

Years of Credited Services

< 5 Years 5-10 Years > 10 Years

2

Redhorse Paid Time Off Program

Effective 12.1.2023

Part-time Employees (60-79 hours worked per bi-weekly pay period) Maximum Annual Vacation Accrual 80 Hours (10 Days) 120 Hours (15 Days) 160 Hours (20 Days)

Maximum Vacation Accrual Cap 120 hours 180 hours 240 hours

Years of Credited Services

  
A) 120 Hours (15 Days)
B) 160 Hours (20 Days)
C) 200 Hours (25 Days)
D) 240 Hours (30 Days)

You put a marble in a cup, then place it upside down on a table. Now you lift the cup up and put it in the microwave. Where is the marble now?
A) In the cup
B) In the microwave
C) On the table
D) It disappeared
